snippet: The long delays in the death-penalty system are another sign of just how dysfunctional it is, and some judges are taking notice.
abstract: Editorial praises United States District Judge Cormac Carney for ruling that California's death penalty system violates Eighth Amendment's ban on cruel and unusual punishment, due to inordinate and unpredictable delays; notes ruling overturned death sentence of Ernest Dewayne Jones, who was sentenced in 1995; observes that nationwide average time from sentencing to execution is almost 16 years.
lead_paragraph: The long delays in the death-penalty system are another sign of just how dysfunctional it is, and some judges are taking notice.

headline.main: A Lifetime on California’s Death Row
headline.print_headline: A Lifetime on California’s Death Row
